intro: Campylostemon mucronatus, commonly known as the narrow-leafed mallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a perennial herb with slender, hairy stems and palmate leaves that are typically less than 10 centimeters in diameter. The plant produces small, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Its botanical features make it a distinctive member of the Malvaceae family.
